> >From: Derek James <djames@...>
> >
> >Good to hear your experiments are going well...but the link to the
> >status page isn't working for me.

Turns out the problem was if you hit the page between the time when a new 
generation is created, but before the first packet is returned.  I was 
getting a divide-by-zero that I shouldn't have gotten, but did.  Fixed it.  
That shouldn't happen again...I hope. :)

Best of all, I decided something...  if 95% of the population has a 'stable' 
fitness value, then what that tells me is that it has had plenty of time to 
stabalize, yet the remaining 5% is fluctuating too much to be considered 
stable.  That means that its results are somewhat random in nature, meaning 
it probably has low fitness anyway.  Which tends to be the case.  So I 
decided that I would be willing to end a generation once 95% of the 
population has a stable fitness.  The result:  I end each generation faster 
(like after 70-80 samples vs. 256), so the overall pace of the experiment is 
appreciably faster now.  YEAH!

Of course, more machines contributing would still be helpful and 
appreciated... ;)

-- John
